detailed_goals: Spend time gathering reference materials for both environment and character design.
Research landscapes, architecture, and cultural elements relevant to the game's setting.
Explore design styles and character designs from similar genres for inspiration.
Create a mood board to visualize themes and concepts.
Lead a brainstorming session to define key user interaction features for the game.
Create wireframes for the new UI elements based on feedback from the design team.
Develop a prototype for one of the features to gather initial feedback from stakeholders.
Participate in the brainstorming session to define key user interaction features.
Assist in creating wireframes for the new UI elements based on feedback.
Support development of a prototype for one of the features.

Assist in creating wireframes for the new UI elements based on feedback.

Research best practices in system architecture relevant to the game's genre.
Draft initial architecture diagrams outlining core systems and their interactions.
Present proposed architecture to the development team for initial feedback.

Present proposed architecture to the development team for initial feedback.
Research and select appropriate build tools and technologies.
Set up a version control system and establish branching strategies.
Create initial scripts for automating build processes for client and server components.
Review game design documents and identify key gameplay flows, features, and mechanics that require testing.
Collaborate with developers to understand anticipated changes and focus areas.
Draft a testing strategy document outlining different testing types and methodologies.
Gather reference materials for character movement styles and animations.
Collaborate with others to discuss ideas for props that enhance gameplay.
Collect environment asset references that complement the game setting.

Define key milestones and production schedules for the project.
Ensure alignment on deliverables and deadlines with the entire team.
Set up initial meetings to establish communication and collaboration protocols.
Conduct user research through surveys or interviews to gather insights on player experiences.
Analyze existing UI elements and user flows to identify pain points.
Create user personas to represent different player types within the game.
Research architectural patterns suitable for the game (e.g., component-based architecture).
Define key systems such as input handling and game state management.
Collaborate with Systems Designers to ensure the architecture aligns with the gameplay vision.
Review existing asset formats and determine optimal settings for importing into the game engine.
Create guidelines for asset preparation to ensure seamless integration.
Set up a project structure that organizes assets efficiently within the engine.
Conduct meetings with teams to discuss pain points and tool requirements.
Analyze existing workflows to determine gaps and opportunities for improvement.
Compile a list of prioritized tool features based on feedback.
Research various level designs that align with the game’s narrative.
Create rough sketches of multiple level layouts, identifying key gameplay areas.
Collaborate with the design team to gather initial feedback on proposed layouts.
Research and collect sound effects that align with the themes of the game.
Collaborate with the design team to understand specific audio requirements.
Create a sound library cataloging collected effects for easy access.
Research and choose cloud service providers for game server needs.
Outline network architecture diagrams illustrating server instances and connections.
Collaborate with the systems design team on network requirements.
